result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marquise Jermaine Adams

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marquise Jermaine Adams appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court for Marquise Jermaine Adams.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling conference.  Defense has received an offer from the State and requests a motion hearing date be set for hearing on Motion to Suppress.  Court sets deadline of 12/1/2022 for Defense to file its Motion and deadline of 1/3/2023 for State to file its response.  Defendant to be produced if still in custody.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Motion hearing scheduled for January 26, 2023 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Marquise Jermaine Adams in court, in custody.  Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court for Marquise Jermaine Adams.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Arraignment. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Defense has received discovery, but still needs an offer from the State. Court schedules next court date for a Scheduling conference.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Marquise Jermaine Adams appeared by video, in custody in HOC.  Attorney Heather L. Johnson appeared by video for Marquise Jermaine Adams.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Van Grunsven Branch 09.  Original Information filed. Defense Counsel requests an Arraignment. Court ordered case adjourned for Branch 09.
Arraignment scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marquise Jermaine Adams not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Johnson is in trial. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Marquise Jermaine Adams in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Marquise Jermaine Adams in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marquise Jermaine Adams appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Van Grunsven, Branch 09. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
